Document.TEXT: Classified in: PUNE, India , February 1, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- An increased corporate and government funding drives the transmission electron microscope market growth with universities getting grants from government as R&D budget, and based on these grants and public funding, devices such as microscope are purchased. Since the cost of TEM runs to million dollars, it can only be bought with government or corporate backing. Complete report on transmission electron microscope market spread across 55 pages, analyzing 3 major companies and providing 29 data exhibits is now available at http://www.sandlerresearch.org/global-transmission-electron-microscope-market-2015-2019.html . The analysts forecast global transmission electron microscope market to grow at a CAGR of 12.2% during the period 2015-2019. This market is heavily dependent on the government funding in research projects and is expected to be driven by factors like the increased government spending on microscopes in countries like America and China . The global transmission electron microscope market analysts estimate the APAC region to account for more than 41% of the total market share by 2019. The government of China's increasing investment in R&D of material science, life science, nanotechnology, and semiconductors is expected to account for this region's high market dominance during the forecast period. Since TEM can present only 2D images of the specimen and has limitations with respect to the specimen size, microscopes that combine the features of both TEM and SEM have been introduced. For instance, Nion, a second generation spherical aberration corrector for TEM manufacturer, has now shifted to STEM due to its high advantages over TEM. Transmission electron microscope market research analyst has estimated the material science segment to exhibit the highest market growth rate during the forecast period. Since TEM aids in the development and discovery of new materials in the material science segment, its demand is envisaged to increase during the forecast period. Order a copy of Global Transmission Electron Microscope Market 2015-2019 report @ http://www.sandlerresearch.org/purchase?rname=50282 . The industries segment is envisaged to account for nearly 44% of the total market share by 2019. TEM's usefulness in root cause analysis is a significant trend that is expected to bolster its adoption in the industries segment during the forecast period. The global transmission electron microscope market is primarily dominated by large vendors like JEOL and FEI. These vendors together account for nearly 60% of the overall market during the forecast period and focus on manufacturing optical microscopes or hybrid forms of TEM such as STEM As the cost of manufacturing such microscopes is high; only three vendors currently dominate the market as they have the capability to manufacture advanced versions of TEM such as STEM. Leading vendors in the global transmission electron microscope market are FEI, Hitachi High Technologies and JEOL. Other prominent vendors in the market are Delong America , Siemens, and Sigma Aldrich Corp. Further, the transmission electron microscope market report states that the growing demand for multipurpose electron microscope poses a challenge to the growth of this market. Market research analyst has estimated the Americas to dominate over all the other geographies owing to the rise in adoption of upcoming research equipment like near field scanning optical microscopes (NSOM). The widespread availability of advanced labs and trained research technicians in this region are expected to result in this region's high market share of close to 49% during the forecast period.
